Pre-Game Insights: Didier Deschamps has made some bold decisions in his most recent France squad selection leading up to next month’s international break.
Coach Deschamps has announced the squad in the upcoming UEFA Nations League fixtures next month.
Three players have been excluded from their Euro 2024 squad: Benjamin Pavard, Kingsley Coman, and Adrien Rabiot.
Kylian Mbappe is set to make his long-awaited return to the French national team after joining Real Madrid.
Olivier Giroud, currently representing Major League Soccer team Los Angeles FC, decided to end his international career following the conclusion of the European Championship.
The victorious Les Bleus, who emerged triumphant in the Nations League this year, are set to face off against Israel in League A Group 2.
Sandro Tonali was recently reinstated into Italy’s squad following a 10-month suspension related to gambling.
Coach Luciano Spalletti has recently included Leicester defender Caleb Okoli and Atalanta midfielder Marco Brescianini in the squad for upcoming Nations League matches against France and Israel.
Unfortunately, Nicolò Barella, a crucial midfielder, was unable to join the squad due to a sinus issue.

Tonali has made a comeback on the pitch, playing for Newcastle. Almost a year ago, he faced a ban from the Italian football federation due to his involvement in betting on matches involving AC Milan and Brescia, teams he used to play for.
